verses.kjv: And the whole multitude of them arose, and led him unto Pilate.
verses.web: The whole company of them rose up and brought him before Pilate.
verses.ct: Then the entire assembly rose and brought Jesus before Pilate.

verses.kjv: And they began to accuse him, saying, We found this fellow perverting the nation, and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar, saying that he himself is Christ a King.
verses.web: They began to accuse him, saying, “We found this man perverting the nation, forbidding paying taxes to Caesar, and saying that he himself is Christ, a king.”
verses.ct: They began accusing him, saying, "We caught this man misleading our nation, telling people not to pay taxes to Caesar, and claiming to be Christ, a king."

verses.kjv: And Pilate asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered him and said, Thou sayest it.
verses.web: Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” He answered him, “So you say.”
verses.ct: Pilate asked him, "Are you the King of the Jews?" Jesus answered, "You said it yourself."

verses.kjv: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and to the people, I find no fault in this man.
verses.web: Pilate said to the chief priests and the multitudes, “I find no basis for a charge against this man.”
verses.ct: Pilate turned to the chief priests and the crowd and said, "I find nothing wrong with this man."

verses.kjv: And they were the more fierce, saying, He stirreth up the people, teaching throughout all Jewry, beginning from Galilee to this place.
verses.web: But they insisted, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee even to this place.”
verses.ct: But they pressed harder, insisting, "He stirs up trouble among the people with his teaching all across Judea — starting in Galilee and now here!"

verses.kjv: When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the man were a Galilaean.
verses.web: But when Pilate heard Galilee mentioned, he asked if the man was a Galilean.
verses.ct: When Pilate heard the word "Galilee," he asked whether the man was a Galilean.

verses.kjv: And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time.
verses.web: When he found out that he was in Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem during those days.
verses.ct: Once he learned that Jesus fell under Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him over to Herod, who happened to be in Jerusalem at the time.

verses.kjv: And when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceeding glad: for he was desirous to see him of a long season, because he had heard many things of him; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him.
verses.web: Now when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceedingly glad, for he had wanted to see him for a long time, because he had heard many things about him. He hoped to see some miracle done by him.
verses.ct: Herod was thrilled to see Jesus. He had wanted to meet him for a long time because he'd heard so much about him, and he was hoping to watch him perform some kind of miracle.

verses.kjv: Then he questioned with him in many words; but he answered him nothing.
verses.web: He questioned him with many words, but he gave no answers.
verses.ct: Herod bombarded him with question after question, but Jesus didn't answer a single one.

verses.kjv: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him.
verses.web: The chief priests and the scribes stood, vehemently accusing him.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the chief priests and the scribes stood nearby, hurling fierce accusations at him.

verses.kjv: And Herod with his men of war set him at nought, and mocked him, and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe, and sent him again to Pilate.
verses.web: Herod with his soldiers humiliated him and mocked him. Dressing him in luxurious clothing, they sent him back to Pilate.
verses.ct: Herod and his soldiers treated Jesus with contempt and mocked him. They dressed him in an elegant robe and sent him back to Pilate.

verses.kjv: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together: for before they were at enmity between themselves.
verses.web: Herod and Pilate became friends with each other that very day, for before that they were enemies with each other.
verses.ct: That very day, Herod and Pilate became friends — before this, they had been enemies.

verses.kjv: And Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
verses.web: Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people,
verses.ct: Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people.

verses.kjv: Said unto them, Ye have brought this man unto me, as one that perverteth the people: and, behold, I, having examined him before you, have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him:
verses.web: and said to them, “You brought this man to me as one that perverts the people, and behold, having examined him before you, I found no basis for a charge against this man concerning those things of which you accuse him.
verses.ct: He told them, "You brought this man to me, claiming he was leading the people astray. I've examined him right here in front of you, and I find no basis for any of the charges you're bringing against him."

verses.kjv: No, nor yet Herod: for I sent you to him; and, lo, nothing worthy of death is done unto him.
verses.web: Neither has Herod, for I sent you to him, and see, nothing worthy of death has been done by him.
verses.ct: "Neither did Herod, because he sent him back to us. Clearly, this man has done nothing that deserves death."

verses.kjv: I will therefore chastise him, and release him.
verses.web: I will therefore chastise him and release him.”
verses.ct: "So I'll have him flogged and then let him go."

verses.kjv: (For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast.)
verses.web: Now he had to release one prisoner to them at the feast.
verses.ct: (It was customary for Pilate to release one prisoner to the people during the feast.)

verses.kjv: And they cried out all at once, saying, Away with this man, and release unto us Barabbas:
verses.web: But they all cried out together, saying, “Away with this man! Release to us Barabbas!”—
verses.ct: But the whole crowd shouted together, "Get rid of this man! Release Barabbas to us!"

verses.kjv: (Who for a certain sedition made in the city, and for murder, was cast into prison.)
verses.web: one who was thrown into prison for a certain revolt in the city, and for murder.
verses.ct: Barabbas had been thrown in prison for starting a revolt in the city and for murder.

verses.kjv: Pilate therefore, willing to release Jesus, spake again to them.
verses.web: Then Pilate spoke to them again, wanting to release Jesus,
verses.ct: Pilate wanted to release Jesus, so he appealed to the crowd again.

verses.kjv: But they cried, saying, Crucify him, crucify him.
verses.web: but they shouted, saying, “Crucify! Crucify him!”
verses.ct: But they kept shouting, "Crucify him! Crucify him!"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them the third time, Why, what evil hath he done? I have found no cause of death in him: I will therefore chastise him, and let him go.
verses.web: He said to them the third time, “Why? What evil has this man done? I have found no capital crime in him. I will therefore chastise him and release him.”
verses.ct: A third time Pilate spoke to them: "Why? What crime has he committed? I've found no reason to execute him. I'll have him flogged and release him."

verses.kjv: And they were instant with loud voices, requiring that he might be crucified. And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed.
verses.web: But they were urgent with loud voices, asking that he might be crucified. Their voices and the voices of the chief priests prevailed.
verses.ct: But they kept screaming louder and louder, demanding that Jesus be crucified. Eventually their voices — along with those of the chief priests — won out.

verses.kjv: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.
verses.web: Pilate decreed that what they asked for should be done.
verses.ct: Pilate gave in and handed down the ruling they wanted.

verses.kjv: And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he delivered Jesus to their will.
verses.web: He released him who had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder, for whom they asked, but he delivered Jesus up to their will.
verses.ct: He released the man they asked for — the one imprisoned for revolt and murder — and handed Jesus over to be dealt with as they wished.

verses.kjv: And as they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon, a Cyrenian, coming out of the country, and on him they laid the cross, that he might bear it after Jesus.
verses.web: When they led him away, they grabbed one Simon of Cyrene, coming from the country, and laid on him the cross, to carry it after Jesus.
verses.ct: As they led Jesus away, they grabbed a man named Simon from Cyrene who was coming in from the countryside. They put the cross on his back and made him carry it behind Jesus.

verses.kjv: And there followed him a great company of people, and of women, which also bewailed and lamented him.
verses.web: A great multitude of the people followed him, including women who also mourned and lamented him.
verses.ct: A huge crowd followed, including women who were weeping and mourning for him.

verses.kjv: But Jesus turning unto them said, Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.
verses.web: But Jesus, turning to them, said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, don’t weep for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.
verses.ct: Jesus turned to them and said, "Daughters of Jerusalem, don't weep for me. Weep for yourselves and for your children."

verses.kjv: For, behold, the days are coming, in the which they shall say, Blessed are the barren, and the wombs that never bare, and the paps which never gave suck.
verses.web: For behold, the days are coming in which they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, the wombs that never bore, and the breasts that never nursed.’
verses.ct: "Because the days are coming when people will say, 'Blessed are the women who never had children — the wombs that never carried a baby and the breasts that never nursed.'"

verses.kjv: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us; and to the hills, Cover us.
verses.web: Then they will begin to tell the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and tell the hills, ‘Cover us.’
verses.ct: "Then people will beg the mountains, 'Fall on us!' and plead with the hills, 'Cover us!'"

verses.kjv: For if they do these things in a green tree, what shall be done in the dry?
verses.web: For if they do these things in the green tree, what will be done in the dry?”
verses.ct: "For if they do this when the tree is green, what will happen when it's dry?"

verses.kjv: And there were also two other, malefactors, led with him to be put to death.
verses.web: There were also others, two criminals, led with him to be put to death.
verses.ct: Two criminals were also led out with him to be executed.

verses.kjv: And when they were come to the place, which is called Calvary, there they crucified him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand, and the other on the left.
verses.web: When they came to the place that is called “The Skull”, they crucified him there with the criminals, one on the right and the other on the left.
verses.ct: When they arrived at the place called The Skull, they crucified him there along with the 2 criminals — one on his right and one on his left.

verses.kjv: Then said Jesus, Father, forgive them; for they know not what they do. And they parted his raiment, and cast lots.
verses.web: Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they don’t know what they are doing.” Dividing his garments among them, they cast lots.
verses.ct: Jesus said, "Father, forgive them, for they don't know what they're doing." Meanwhile, the soldiers divided up his clothes by casting lots.

verses.kjv: And the people stood beholding. And the rulers also with them derided him, saying, He saved others; let him save himself, if he be Christ, the chosen of God.
verses.web: The people stood watching. The rulers with them also scoffed at him, saying, “He saved others. Let him save himself, if this is the Christ of God, his chosen one!”
verses.ct: The people stood watching. The rulers sneered at him, saying, "He saved others — let him save himself if he really is Christ, God's chosen one!"

verses.kjv: And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, and offering him vinegar,
verses.web: The soldiers also mocked him, coming to him and offering him vinegar,
verses.ct: The soldiers joined in the mockery too, coming up to him and offering him sour wine.

verses.kjv: And saying, If thou be the king of the Jews, save thyself.
verses.web: and saying, “If you are the King of the Jews, save yourself!”
verses.ct: They taunted, "If you're the King of the Jews, save yourself!"

verses.kjv: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek, and Latin, and Hebrew, THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.web: An inscription was also written over him in letters of Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: “THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
verses.ct: Above him was a sign written in Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.kjv: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him, saying, If thou be Christ, save thyself and us.
verses.web: One of the criminals who was hanged insulted him, saying, “If you are the Christ, save yourself and us!”
verses.ct: One of the criminals hanging beside him hurled insults at him: "Aren't you the Christ? Save yourself — and us while you're at it!"

verses.kjv: But the other answering rebuked him, saying, Dost not thou fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?
verses.web: But the other answered, and rebuking him said, “Don’t you even fear God, seeing you are under the same condemnation?
verses.ct: But the other criminal rebuked him: "Don't you even fear God? You're facing the same death sentence he is."

verses.kjv: And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.
verses.web: And we indeed justly, for we receive the due reward for our deeds, but this man has done nothing wrong.”
verses.ct: "We deserve what we're getting — we earned this punishment. But this man has done nothing wrong."

verses.kjv: And he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom.
verses.web: He said to Jesus, “Lord, remember me when you come into your Kingdom.”
verses.ct: Then he said, "Jesus, Lord, remember me when you come into your kingdom."

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, To day shalt thou be with me in paradise.
verses.web: Jesus said to him, “Assuredly I tell you, today you will be with me in Paradise.”
verses.ct: Jesus told him, "I promise you, today you will be with me in Paradise."

verses.kjv: And it was about the sixth hour, and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.
verses.web: It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour.
verses.ct: It was now about noon, and darkness fell over the entire land until 3 in the afternoon.

verses.kjv: And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.
verses.web: The sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was torn in two.
verses.ct: The sun stopped shining, and the curtain in the temple was torn right down the middle.

verses.kjv: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit: and having said thus, he gave up the ghost.
verses.web: Jesus, crying with a loud voice, said, “Father, into your hands I commit my spirit!” Having said this, he breathed his last.
verses.ct: Jesus cried out in a loud voice, "Father, into your hands I commit my spirit!" After saying this, he breathed his last.

verses.kjv: Now when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.
verses.web: When the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, “Certainly this was a righteous man.”
verses.ct: When the Roman centurion saw what had happened, he praised God and said, "There is no doubt — this was a righteous man."

verses.kjv: And all the people that came together to that sight, beholding the things which were done, smote their breasts, and returned.
verses.web: All the multitudes that came together to see this, when they saw the things that were done, returned home beating their breasts.
verses.ct: The crowds who had gathered to watch, after seeing everything that took place, beat their chests in grief and went home.

verses.kjv: And all his acquaintance, and the women that followed him from Galilee, stood afar off, beholding these things.
verses.web: All his acquaintances and the women who followed with him from Galilee stood at a distance, watching these things.
verses.ct: All of Jesus' friends, including the women who had followed him from Galilee, stood at a distance watching everything.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there was a man named Joseph, a counsellor; and he was a good man, and a just:
verses.web: Behold, a man named Joseph, who was a member of the council, a good and righteous man
verses.ct: Now there was a man named Joseph, a member of the Jewish council, who was a good and righteous man.

verses.kjv: (The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them;) he was of Arimathaea, a city of the Jews: who also himself waited for the kingdom of God.
verses.web: (he had not consented to their counsel and deed), from Arimathaea, a city of the Jews, who was also waiting for God’s Kingdom:
verses.ct: He had not agreed with the council's decision or their actions. He was from the town of Arimathaea in Judea, and he was waiting for the kingdom of God.

verses.kjv: This man went unto Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus.
verses.web: this man went to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body.
verses.ct: Joseph went to Pilate and asked for Jesus' body.

verses.kjv: And he took it down, and wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone, wherein never man before was laid.
verses.web: He took it down, and wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb that was cut in stone, where no one had ever been laid.
verses.ct: He took it down from the cross, wrapped it in linen cloth, and placed it in a tomb carved out of rock where no one had ever been buried.

verses.kjv: And that day was the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.
verses.web: It was the day of the Preparation, and the Sabbath was drawing near.
verses.ct: It was Preparation Day, and the Sabbath was about to begin.

verses.kjv: And the women also, which came with him from Galilee, followed after, and beheld the sepulchre, and how his body was laid.
verses.web: The women, who had come with him out of Galilee, followed after, and saw the tomb, and how his body was laid.
verses.ct: The women who had come with Jesus from Galilee followed Joseph and saw the tomb and how his body was placed inside.

verses.kjv: And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment.
verses.web: They returned and prepared spices and ointments. On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.
verses.ct: Then they went home and prepared spices and ointments. But when the Sabbath came, they rested as the commandment required.
